alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 19 at 3:00AM MDT until June 19 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT TODAY ACROSS WEST CENTRAL AND NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF NEW MEXICO AND THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, HOT TEMPERATURES, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry, and unstable conditions will continue today. Breezy to locally windy southwest winds will combine with minimum relative humidity in the low teens to create several hours of critical fire weather for portions of New Mexico today. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), West Central Mountains (Zone 105) and the West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from noon to 9 PM MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 8 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
